terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and collaborate safely.
A system that allows content to be updated, modified, and published in real-time without requiring manual file replacements or system restarts.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit, comment on, and update documents with changes visible instantly to all participants.
A systematic approach to monitoring and documenting adherence to regulatory requirements, policies, and standards within an organization.
A document that is continuously updated and revised to reflect current information, policies, or procedures rather than remaining static.
A pre-designed document structure or format that serves as a starting point for creating new documents with consistent formatting and sections.
Content that combines different types of media such as text, images, videos, and interactive elements to enhance user engagement and comprehension.
An organized list of a document's sections and subsections with corresponding page numbers or links for easy navigation.
Hyperlinks that connect different pages or sections within the same website or document system to improve navigation and SEO.
Search Engine Optimization - the practice of optimizing content and websites to improve their visibility and ranking in search engine results.
Specific words or phrases that content creators strategically include in their content to improve search engine rankings and discoverability.
A structured approach to employee discipline that escalates consequences through predetermined steps, typically from verbal warnings to termination.
Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act - a federal law that protects the privacy of student education records and gives parents certain rights regarding their children's records.
terms.expanded: Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act
